result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Dale A Bergen was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 125 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Village of Menomonee Falls Police Department.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Ignition interlock device to be installed.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Court Reporter, Joni Smith, From Sentencing Hearing Held on 01/05/17.

Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Dale A Bergen in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed by operation of law.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  66 month
Initial Confinement:  2.5 years.
Extended Supervision:  3 Years.
125 Days Credit.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device to be installed.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided.

Transcript Fee - State Has 10 Days to file their request - Upon Request - Court will grant.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 (to be forward to Village of Menomonee Falls Police Department);
FINE:  $1,519
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail.
Balance to be refunded to the posting party.

36 Months D/L REVOCATION:
36 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK: 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  


Defendant remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant to be transferred to DCI - FORTHWITH.
Treatment Letter and Character Letter, received and filed in court.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
